GPS 136.title: Theories of Peace, Conflict and Violence
GPS 136.comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Interdisciplinary 197A.
GPS 136.description: Fundamental issues relating to global peace and security: Focus on "negative peace"--the problem of war and organized violence; peace as the avoidance of war.

GPS 137.title: World Society in Transformation: Building Enduring Peace
GPS 137.comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Interdisciplinary 197B.
GPS 137.description: Fundamental exploration of issues relating to global peace and security with a focus on "positive peace"--peace as human rights, sustainable development, ecological balance, political participation and other positive aspects of human security.

GPS 140.title: Theory and Practice of Nonviolence
GPS 140.comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Interdisciplinary 140.
GPS 140.description: Critical examination of nonviolence as a philosophy of life and as a pragmatic approach to conflict resolution. Philosophical, psychological, cultural, and political aspects. Major theorists of nonviolence including Gandhi, King, Dharp. Application to confict at all levels: interpersonal, intergroup, and international. Case studies.

GPS 194.title: Group Studies for Global Peace and Security
GPS 194.comments: May be repeated for credit in combination with Interdisciplinary 194GP to amaximum of 12 units, but only 4 units may be applied toward the major.
GPS 194.description: Intensive analysis of topics and themes in global peace and security. Topics will vary with instructor and year.

GPS 196.title: Global Peace and Security Seminar
GPS 196.comments: May be repeated for credit to a maximum of 12 units, but only 4 units may be applied toward the major. Not open for credit to students who have completed Interdisciplinary 196GP.
GPS 196.description: Intensive analysis of methods and problems of global peace and security. Topics will vary with the instructor and quarter.
